alert.note: Alert for Ferry; Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 16 at 6:17PM PDT until May 16 at 9:15PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Eastern Okanogan County in north central Washington... Western Ferry County in northeastern Washington... * Until 915 PM PDT. * At 617 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 1.25 inches per 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, and streets as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Wauconda, Bonaparte Lake Campground and Lost Lake Campground. Steep terrain near the Walker Creek burn scar along the Henderson, Lightning, Beaver and Pettijohn creeks. US 20 from milepost 268 to 292. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-1.25 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move away from recently burned areas. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
